category: Sin, Disbelief & People Of The Qibla

title: Human Deeds Are Created By Allah
text: Human deeds are in reality created by Allah ﷻ, and at the same time are done and accounted for by the human being.
explanation:
Human deeds are in reality created by Allah (He brings them about), and at the same time are done and accounted for by the human being. This is the middle way: neither Jabariyya (all is compelled) nor Qadariyya (the human creates his own deed).

Sūrat aṣ-Ṣāffāt: 96: Allah created you and what you do. Hadith: there is no power or strength except with Allah. Scholars of Ahl as-Sunnah affirm that the servant’s deed is Allah’s creation and the servant’s acquisition (kasb); the human is held accountable.

We strive and believe that the outcome is from Allah; we are neither passive (Jabariyya) nor do we regard ourselves as the creator of our deed (Qadariyya). We are accountable for our choice.

title: Allah’s Covenant With All Mankind
text: The covenant that Allah ﷻ made with Adam and his offspring is true.
explanation:
The covenant that Allah made with Adam and his offspring (taken from Adam’s loins) is true: the acknowledgment that Allah is Lord. This is mentioned in the Quran; humans are born in fitra, then environment and choice have their effect.

Sūrat al-Aʿrāf: 172–173 relate that Allah took a covenant from the offspring of Adam: Am I not your Lord? They said: Yes. Sound hadith affirms that every child is born in fitra. Scholars take this as evidence for fitra and human responsibility.

We believe that humans have a fitra to know the Lord; our call reminds and invites; it does not "insert" something foreign. We are responsible for our choice after maturity and reason.

title: Allah’s Names And Attributes Are Permanent
text: Just as Allah ﷻ has the right to the name “He who gives life to the dead” before and after giving life to the dead, so too Allah ﷻ has the right to the name “Creator” before and after creating.
explanation:
Allah has the right to the name “He who gives life to the dead” before and after actually giving life; and likewise “Creator” before and after creating. Allah’s attributes and names do not depend on events; He always possesses His attributes.

Sūrat al-Ḥadīd: 3: He is the First and the Last. Allah’s names are eternal. Scholars affirm that Allah is always Al-Khāliq, Al-Muḥyī, etc., without “newly” having an attribute after an event. This rejects the view that doubts Allah’s attributes before creation.

We do not ask “when did Allah have the attribute of Creator”; we believe Allah is perfect from eternity. This belief preserves the purity of tawhid and rejects philosophy that doubts Allah’s attributes.

title: All That Happens Is By Allah’s Will
text: Everything happens according to the will, knowledge, decree, and determination of Allah ﷻ; Allah’s ﷻ will prevails over other wills, and Allah ﷻ is never unjust, is free from evil, and is perfect and free from defect.
explanation:
Everything happens according to the will, knowledge, decree, and determination of Allah. Allah’s will prevails over other wills; Allah is never unjust, is free from evil, and is perfect and free from defect.

Sūrat Yāsīn: 82: When He wills a thing His command is only “Be” and it is. Sūrat al-Burūj: 16: He is the One who wills. Hadith and verses often affirm Allah’s power and will. Allah is not unjust; His decree contains wisdom.

We leave all matters to Allah and do not accuse Allah of injustice. We believe that what befalls us is in accordance with His decree and will; we strive and rely on Him.

title: Human Will Is Dependent On Allah
text: Everything happens according to the decree and will of Allah ﷻ; what a human wills is only realised if Allah ﷻ wills it.
explanation:
Everything happens according to the decree and will of Allah; what a human wills is only realised if Allah wills it. Human will is not independent; it is subject to Allah’s will.

Sūrat at-Takwīr: 29: You do not will except that Allah wills. Hadith: there is no power or strength except with Allah. Scholars affirm that Allah’s will (mashīʾa) encompasses all that occurs; the creature’s will follows.

We will and strive, but we believe that the final outcome is in Allah’s hand. We are not arrogant when we succeed nor do we despair when we fail; we rely on Him after our effort.

title: The Truth Of The Law Through The Prophet Muhammad
text: All that is established from the Prophet ﷺ regarding the law and its explanation (the Quran and Islam) is true.
explanation:
All that is established from the Prophet regarding the law and its explanation—the Quran and the Sunnah, the lawful and unlawful, worship, and character—is true. We accept it without doubt and act upon it.

Sūrat al-Ḥashr: 7: Whatever the Messenger gives you, take it; whatever he forbids you, leave it. Sound, widely transmitted hadith affirms that the Prophet did not speak from caprice. The Quran and the Sunnah are the source of truth.

We do not pick and choose or reject part of the law; we accept all that is soundly from the Prophet. We do not follow opinions that contradict clear evidence.

title: All Creation Is Subject To Allah’s Rule
text: All creation is subject to the will of Allah ﷻ, whether through Allah’s ﷻ grace or through Allah’s ﷻ justice.
explanation:
All creation is subject to the will of Allah, whether through His grace (blessing, guidance, mercy) or through His justice (punishment, trial). Nothing is outside His decree.

Sūrat Āl ʿImrān: 83: Do they seek other than the religion of Allah? Yet to Him submits whoever is in the heavens and the earth. Verses and hadith often affirm that everything is subject to Allah. Allah’s grace and justice are perfect.

We accept the decree with openness: we are grateful for blessing and patient in trial. We do not protest Allah’s decree; we believe that Allah is Most Just and Most Merciful.

title: Believers Are The Allies Of Allah
text: All believers are allies of Allah ﷻ, and the most noble in Allah’s ﷻ sight are the most obedient and the most faithful to the Quran.
explanation:
All believers are allies of Allah (beloved of Allah in the general sense); the most noble in Allah’s sight are the most obedient and the most faithful to the Quran. Excellence is based on piety and following, not on claim or title.

Sūrat Yūnus: 62–63: Behold, the allies of Allah have no fear nor do they grieve—those who believe and are God-fearing. Hadith affirms that the ally of Allah is one who obeys; we know them by their deeds, not by their claim. We do not exalt a particular “ally” above the evidence.

We strive to be allies of Allah through obedience and following the Quran and Sunnah; we do not claim to be allies or exalt others without basis. Excellence is with Allah and is based on deeds.

title: Human Deeds According To Allah's Knowledge
text: All human deeds occur exactly as Allah ﷻ knows; each person is made easy for what he was created for, and the fortunate or the wretched are so by Allah's ﷻ decree.
explanation:
All human deeds occur exactly as Allah knows; each person is made easy for what he was created for (decree), and the fortunate or wretched are so by Allah's decree. This does not negate effort; effort too is part of the decree.

Sūrat al-Layl: 5–10 indicates that some are made easy for good and some for evil. Hadith: each person is made easy for what he was created for. Allah's knowledge precedes the deed; the deed occurs in accordance with His knowledge.

We strive and believe that Allah is the one who makes easy; we are not passive. We do not plead "already decreed wretched" to avoid striving; we rely on Him after effort.

title: The Limit By Which One Leaves Faith
text: A person does not leave faith except by denying what brought him into it.
explanation:
A person does not leave faith except by denying what brought him into faith (i.e. denying a pillar of faith, or making lawful what is clearly unlawful, or believing in disbelief). Sin alone does not remove one from Islam as long as one does not deny the foundation.

Sound hadith: a Muslim must not be declared disbeliever for sin. Leaving Islam occurs by rejecting the testimony of faith, denying what is certain in the religion, or making lawful what is agreed to be unlawful. Scholars state that one who commits a major sin remains a believer if he does not make the sin lawful.

We do not declare disbeliever one who still affirms the pillars of faith and does not make lawful what is unlawful; we distinguish between sin and disbelief. We leave the judgment of disbelief to qualified scholars under strict conditions.

title: The Falsity Of Claiming Prophethood After Muhammad
text: Every claim of prophethood after Muhammad ﷺ is falsehood and deception.
explanation:
Every claim of prophethood after Muhammad is falsehood and deception. There is no prophet or messenger after him; whoever claims prophethood or receives new revelation after him is a liar.

Sūrat al-Aḥzāb: 40: Muhammad is the seal of the prophets. Sound hadith: there is no prophet after me. The Prophet said there would be lying claimants to prophethood; do not believe them. Scholars agree that claiming prophethood after the Prophet is disbelief.

We reject anyone who claims to be prophet, messenger, or recipient of new law after the Prophet Muhammad. We follow only the Quran and the Sunnah; there is no new revelation.

title: Honouring The Companions, Wives And Progeny Of The Prophet
text: Whoever speaks well of the Companions of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, his wives, and his pure progeny is free from the charge of hypocrisy.
explanation:
Whoever speaks well of the Companions of the Messenger of Allah, his wives (the Mothers of the Believers), and his pure progeny (the righteous Ahl al-Bayt) is free from the charge of hypocrisy. Honouring them is part of Islam.

Sūrat al-Aḥzāb: 6 and other verses praise the Prophet's wives. Hadith affirms the excellence of Ahl al-Bayt and the Companions. Reviling them is a sign of hypocrisy or misguidance. Ahl al-Sunnah honour the Companions and Ahl al-Bayt without excess.

We do not revile the Companions, the Prophet's wives, or his righteous progeny; we speak well of them and take them as examples. We reject groups that revile or declare them disbelievers.

title: Prohibition Of Resembling Allah To Humans
text: Whoever describes Allah ﷻ in the same way as humans has disbelieved; Allah ﷻ in His attributes is not like humans.
explanation:
Whoever describes Allah in the same way as humans (tashbīh)—e.g. holding that Allah has limbs like us or sits on a seat like creation—has disbelieved. Allah in His attributes is not like humans.

Sūrat ash-Shūrā: 11: There is nothing like Him. Hadith forbids reflecting on Allah's essence. Scholars affirm that likening Allah to creation is disbelief. We affirm the attributes without asking "how" (takyīf) and without likening (tamthīl).

We do not imagine Allah like creation; we believe in Allah's names and attributes as they have come, without resembling. We reject the doctrines of the mujassimah or mushabbihah.

title: The Permanence Of Paradise And Hell
text: Paradise and Hell are created beings that have no end; Allah ﷻ created them before other creation and created humans to inhabit each; whom Allah ﷻ wills enters Paradise by Allah's ﷻ grace, or enters Hell by Allah's ﷻ justice.
explanation:
Paradise and Hell are created beings that have no end (they are permanent). Allah created them before other creation and created humans to inhabit each. Whom Allah wills enters Paradise by His grace, or enters Hell by His justice.

Sūrat Hūd: 107–108 affirms that Paradise and Hell are permanent. Sound hadith relates that Paradise and Hell have been created. Sūrat ash-Shūrā: 7: Allah created the heavens and the earth and what is between them. The inhabitants of Paradise and Hell abide forever.

We believe in Paradise and Hell as permanent realities; we strive to enter Paradise by deeds and Allah's mercy and to avoid Hell by obedience and repentance.

title: Intercession For Muslims Is True
text: The intercession reserved for Muslims is true, as related in the hadiths.
explanation:
The intercession reserved for Muslims—including the Prophet's intercession for his community on the Day of Resurrection, and other intercessions soundly related in hadith—is true. We believe in it without denying or exaggerating.

Sūrat al-Baqarah: 255 (the Throne Verse) states that none can intercede with Him except by His leave. Widely transmitted hadith relates the Prophet's intercession for his community. Intercession is only by Allah's leave and for whom Allah is pleased.

We hope for the Prophet's intercession and do not rely on deeds alone; we also do not hold that intercession negates Allah's justice. We pray to be among those granted intercession.

title: The Truth Of The Prophet Muhammad's Pond
text: The Pond (al-Ḥawḍ) that Allah ﷻ gave to the Prophet ﷺ to quench his community's thirst on the Day of Resurrection is true.
explanation:
The Pond (al-Ḥawḍ) that Allah gave to the Prophet to quench his community's thirst on the Day of Resurrection is true. Whoever drinks from it will never thirst again. This is mentioned in sound hadith.

Sound hadith (Bukhārī, Muslim) relates that the Prophet has a pond on the Day of Resurrection; whoever drinks from it will never thirst. The Prophet warned that some will be driven away from the pond. We believe without asking "how".

We strive to be among the community that will come to the Prophet's pond; we avoid innovation and division that may lead to being driven away from the pond. This belief increases our love for the Prophet.

title: Allah Is Not Reached By Understanding
text: No imagination can picture Allah ﷻ, and no understanding can encompass Allah ﷻ.
explanation:
No imagination can picture Allah and no understanding can encompass Allah's essence. Human intellect is limited; we believe in Allah without asking "how" (takyīf) and without likening (tamthīl).

Sūrat al-Anʿām: 103: Vision cannot grasp Him, yet He grasps all vision. Hadith: reflect on Allah's creation, do not reflect on Allah's essence. Scholars affirm that the intellect cannot encompass Allah's reality.

We do not imagine Allah's form or "face" with our imagination; we glorify Him and believe in His names and attributes without resemblance. We leave "how" to Allah.

title: No Secret Is Hidden From Allah
text: Nothing about creation was hidden from Allah ﷻ before creation was created, and Allah ﷻ knows all that creation will do before creation was created.
explanation:
Nothing about creation was hidden from Allah before creation; Allah knows all that creation will do before creation was created. Allah's knowledge is eternal and encompasses everything.

Sūrat al-Ḥadīd: 22: No disaster occurs but it is in a book. Sūrat al-Anʿām: 59: With Allah are the keys of the unseen. Hadith affirms that Allah wrote the decree before creation. Allah's knowledge does not change.

We believe in Allah's perfect knowledge; we are not troubled by "Allah already knows" as if we had no choice. We believe that Allah's knowledge does not compel; we still strive and are held accountable.

title: Everything Happens By Allah's Will
text: Nothing happens except what Allah ﷻ wills.
explanation:
Nothing happens except what Allah wills. Allah's will encompasses all events; nothing occurs in heaven or earth without His will (mashīʾa).

Sūrat at-Taghābun: 11: No disaster befalls except by Allah's leave. Sūrat al-Insān: 30: You cannot will except that Allah wills. Hadith and verses affirm this abundantly.

We submit all affairs to Allah's will; we strive and supplicate, then accept His decree. We do not rebel against destiny nor despair.

title: Nothing Can Overcome Allah
text: Nothing can overcome Allah ﷻ.
explanation:
Nothing can overcome Allah. His dominion is absolute; nothing can rival, annul, or frustrate His will.

Sūrat al-Baqarah: 255: Allah neither slumbers nor sleeps; His is all that is in the heavens and the earth. Verses and hadith affirm Allah's power (qudrah). Whoever thinks something can overcome Allah has disbelieved.

We are certain that help and victory come only from Allah; we do not fear creation. We place hope and fear only in Allah.

title: Nothing Is Like Allah
text: Nothing is like Allah ﷻ.
explanation:
Nothing is like Allah. He is uniquely one; there is no equal, partner, or likeness to Him in essence, attributes, or actions.

Sūrat al-Ikhlāṣ: 4: And none is comparable to Him. Sūrat ash-Shūrā: 11: There is nothing like Him. Hadith and consensus affirm tawḥīd. Likening Allah to creation is unbelief.

We declare Allah free from any likeness to creation; we do not imagine or describe Allah with the attributes of creation. This tawḥīd is the foundation of the entire religion.

title: No God Deserves Worship Except Allah
text: No god deserves to be worshipped except Allah ﷻ.
explanation:
No god deserves to be worshipped except Allah. Only Allah is entitled to worship; worshipping other than Him is shirk. The statement lā ilāha illā Allāh is the foundation of Islam.

Sūrat Muḥammad: 19: Know that there is no god but Allah. Sūrat al-Baqarah: 163 and many verses affirm Allah's oneness. Hadith states that lā ilāha illā Allāh is the key to Paradise. Shirk is the gravest sin.

We worship only Allah and do not associate anything with Him. We reject worship of anything other than Allah—whether idols, humans, or caprice.

title: Nothing Can Repel His Decree
text: Nothing can repel Allah's ﷻ decree, reverse Allah's ﷻ command, or overcome Allah's ﷻ affair.
explanation:
Nothing can repel Allah's decree, reverse His command, or overcome His affair. His judgement is final; there is no appeal or veto.

Sūrat ar-Raʿd: 41: Indeed Allah has power over all things. Sūrat al-Anʿām: 59: None can repel His decree. Hadith affirms that nothing can repel Allah's destiny. Allah's power is absolute.

We accept Allah's decree with contentment; we do not rebel or despair. We supplicate and strive, then submit to His all-wise judgement.

title: Honouring The Early Salaf Scholars
text: The salaf scholars—the first generation and those who follow—may only be spoken of in the best terms; whoever speaks ill of the salaf scholars is not on the right path.
explanation:
The salaf scholars—the first generation (Companions, tābiʿūn, tābiʿu t-tābiʿīn) and those who follow their manhaj—may only be spoken of in the best terms. Whoever speaks ill of the salaf scholars is not on the right path.

Sūrat at-Tawba: 100 praises those who were first and foremost. Hadith: the best of people are my generation. The Prophet commanded following the way of the righteous caliphs. Reviling the salaf is innovation and misguidance.

We honour the salaf scholars and take our understanding of the religion from them; we do not revile or belittle them. We follow the manhaj of Ahl as-Sunnah, which holds to the Qur'an, the Sunnah, and the understanding of the salaf.
